change.changenote: Note: This regulation has been placed in the Regulations Point in Time collection. This regulation is not repealed.

reg.title: North American Gypsy Moth Eradication Regulation, 2009

definition.def: means the bacterial insecticide Bacillus thuringiensis var. kurstaki;
means the area outlined in black on the map referenced as the Harrison Spray Eradication Zone in the Appendix to this regulation;
means the area outlined in black on the map referenced as the Harrison Trap Eradication Zone in the Appendix to this regulation;
means the North American gypsy moth.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (2), an inspector may do the following in the Harrison Spray Eradication Zone during the period beginning April 15, 2009, and ending June 20, 2009:

paragraph.paragraphtext: enter on land in order to carry out an activity referred to in paragraph (b) or (c);
search for and remove gypsy moth eggs;

subsection.subsectiontext: An inspector may apply Btk in a spray eradication zone only if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the application is done in accordance with the Integrated Pest Management Act and its regulations, and
the inspector is licensed under that Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: An inspector may do the following in the Harrison Trap Eradication Zone during the period beginning June 15, 2009, and ending October 30, 2009:

paragraph.paragraphtext: enter on land in order to carry out an activity referred to in paragraph (b) or (c);
set or retrieve traps for gypsy moths.
